snippet: The state recorded two of its largest earthquakes in years, fueling concern that burying oil and gas wastes in seismically active areas is courting danger.
abstract: Two earthquakes in northern Oklahoma have once again raised concerns among scientists of consequences of continuing to bury oil and gas wastes from fracking process in seismically active areas, potentially leading to increasingly powerful seismic events; quakes were measured at magnitudes 4.7 and 4.8, largest state has experienced in years.
lead_paragraph: The state recorded two of its largest earthquakes in years, fueling concern that burying oil and gas wastes in seismically active areas is courting danger.

headline.main: Earthquakes in Oklahoma Raise Fears of a Big One
headline.print_headline: Earthquakes in Oklahoma Raise Fears of a Big One
